text: 2008–09 PlusLiga was the 73rd season of Polish Championship (9th season as professional league - PlusLiga) organized by Professional Volleyball League SA () under the supervision of Polish Volleyball Federation (). Trefl Gdańsk was promoted to PlusLiga in this season. In season 2008/2009 PGE Skra Bełchatów and Domex Tytan AZS Częstochowa played in CEV Champions League, AZS UWM Olsztyn and Jastrzębski Węgiel played in CEV Cup, Asseco Resovia Rzeszów in CEV Challenge Cup PGE Skra Bełchatów achieved 5th title of Polish Champion. ==Final standing== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: left;" |- |width=10px bgcolor=#ccffcc| ||Qualified for the 2009–10 CEV Champions League |- |width=10px bgcolor=#bbebff| ||Qualified for the 2009–10 CEV Cup |- |width=10px bgcolor=#e6f8ff| ||Qualified for the 2009–10 CEV Challenge Cup |- |width=10px bgcolor=#FFE7E7| ||Play-offs with the 2nd team of 1st league |- |width=10px bgcolor=#FFCCCC| ||Relegation to the 1st league |- |} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" !width=40|Rank !width=290|Team |- bgcolor=#ccffcc | |align=left|PGE Skra Bełchatów |- bgcolor=#ccffcc | |align=left|Asseco Resovia Rzeszów |- bgcolor=#ccffcc | |align=left|Jastrzębski Węgiel |- bgcolor=#bbebff |4 |align=left|ZAKSA Kędzierzyn-Koźle |- bgcolor=#bbebff |5 |align=left|Domex Tytan AZS Częstochowa |- |6 |align=left|AZS UWM Olsztyn |- |7 |align=left|Delecta Bydgoszcz |- |8 |align=left|J.W.
